summary: Create an Excel-based daily stock tracking template (for every day/month/year) with an Add Item button and printable report format.
architectural_notes: User requires a month-wise printable sheet where each day is a row (1..31) and items appear in columns (pivoted layout), repeating for every month/year; include per-day columns: Opening Stock, Purchase, Total, Sales, Price, Closing Stock.
known_issues: Add Item button is not working (user reported: "Add item button work aagala").

existing_features.title: Create a stock register UI that works like an Excel sheet for recording daily inventory data with columns: Date, Item, Opening Stock, Purchase, Total Quantity, Sales, Price, Closing Stock.
Provide a Year/Month/Day navigation and filtering experience so users can view and edit records for any day in any month for any year.
Implement an “Add Item” button that adds a new item row for the currently selected date (or allows selecting a date) and supports adding multiple items per day.
Persist stock register data in the Motoko backend keyed by year/month/day and item, with CRUD APIs used by the frontend via React Query.
Add a print-ready layout that formats the selected month (or a selected date range) into a clean, printable report with proper page breaks, headers, and a compact table.

Provide an “Export to Excel (.xlsx)” action that downloads the currently selected month (or selected date range) in an Excel-compatible file with the same columns and a print-friendly worksheet layout.

Apply a coherent visual theme and typography for an accounting/stock-register style interface (neutral, paper-like palette) and keep it consistent across the register view, print preview, and export actions.

Fix the Stock Register “Add Item” flow so clicking “Add Item” always inserts a new row that is immediately visible in the grid for the currently selected Year/Month and (if set) Focus Day, without being affected by browser timezone/UTC date conversion issues.

Add a new monthly report layout option that arranges the selected month as a matrix where Days are rows and Items are columns, and each Item column expands into sub-columns: Opening Stock, Purchase, Total Quantity, Sales, Price, Closing Stock.
Update the print flow to support printing the selected month using the new matrix layout as a single print-ready document, including the month/year header (e.g., January 2026) and clean page breaks.
Update the export action to support exporting the selected month in the new matrix layout as an Excel-compatible download, with a filename that includes the selected month and year.
Ensure the month/year navigation continues to drive the matrix output so the same matrix-style single-month printable/exportable file is available for any month in any year.

new_feature_requests.summary: Excel file template to record daily stock details (opening stock, purchase, total quantity, sales, price, closing stock) across every day/month/year
Add Item button (macro/form) to add new stock items/rows easily in the Excel template
Printable format/layout for the stock records (print-ready report view)

Support an alternate monthly layout where Days are rows and Items are columns, with per-day fields (Opening Stock, Purchase, Total, Sales, Price, Closing Stock) and a single-month printable view (e.g., January with 31 rows) repeated for every month/year
